alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Lower Washington County; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 01 at 8:11PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Bryce Canyon Country, Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity, South Central Utah, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, recently burned areas, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Monsoon moisture will linger through the holiday weekend, with the potential for heavy rainfall increased by a storm system stalled along the West Coast. This will bring the opportunity for multiple rounds of heavy rainfall - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Lower Washington County; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park
